newsitem.title: USA: MySoftware Co sees Q4 loss.
newsitem.headline: MySoftware Co sees Q4 loss.

text.p: MySoftware Co Tuesday said it expects to report a net loss of approximately $1.3 million, or $0.30 a share, compared to net income of $621,000, or $0.14 a share a year ago.
In a statement, the company said it expects fourth quarter revenues to fall to about $2.4 million from $4.3 million for the same quarter last year.
The company said final results for the fourth quarter will be announced February 13.

For the year, the company said it expects revenues of approximately $12.9 million, compared to $13.4 million in 1996, and an operating loss of $1.4 million, compared to operating income of $2.0 million in 1995. The expected net loss for 1996 is approximately $1.0 million, or approximately $0.23 per share.

"Our fourth quarter revenues were impacted by the slow retail environment for software sales, resulting from uncertainty in the retail channel," David Mans, president and chief executive officer of MySoftware. "Revenues were also impacted by the lackluster reception to Windows 95 applications."
